Lawrence.Haskell-Baker Wetlands:
The Haskell-Baker Wetlands is a nature preserve and artificially sustained wetland, spanning approximately 640 acres (2.6 km2) south of Lawrence, Kansas, United States. It is associated with the Wakarusa River and sustained by levees and flood controls built in the 1990s.
Baker University owns 573 acres, the major portion of the site; Haskell Indian Nations University holds 27 acres, and the Kansas Department of Wildlife and Parks, and the University of Kansas hold 20 acres each.
